meta.description: Lounge @ B (Closed for Renovation, Temp Lounge at Gate B22) at Dubai International Airport (DXB), Terminal 3, Concourse B. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: Lounge @ B (Closed for Renovation, Temp Lounge at Gate B22)

location.terminalDirections: Next to Gate B26, above McDonald's on the 2nd Floor, accessible via escalator, entrance is located inside the Cadiz Tapas Bar.

lounge.description: The perfect place to spend your layover. Escape the hustle and bustle of the noisy, busy terminal, and relax in a quiet, peaceful oasis with beautiful decor to boot. Savor outstanding food, rest up, take a nap, or catch up on some work. Get away from it all. Come back to reality refreshed, rejuvenated, ready to take on the world.

general: Children under 2 years old are admitted free with an adult.
warning: Passengers departing from Concourse A or C in Terminal 3 must allow sufficient time (approximately 20-40 minutes) to reach their departure gate.
Offsite shower facilities available upon request. The shower facilities are located at the Dubai International Hotel (a 10 minute walk from Lounge @ B).
Complimentary alcoholic drinks on select liquors only. During the month of Ramadan, alcoholic drinks are only available between 8:00 pm - 3:00 am and are subject to request.
regulatory: This lounge is accessible for passengers departing from Terminal 3 only. Terminal 3 is used exclusively by Emirates and codeshare flights with Qantas.

reviews.content: The overall atmosphere and the food were great.
Good place to relax as it wasn’t crowded in the evening. Food and beverage was ok. Toilet facilities inside the lounge are OK too. Wifi was very poor. Shower was good but didn’t have a toilet.
In covid environment, server dished buffet items, tables spaced appropriately, staff continuously sanitized spaces, and not crowded.
Noisy, crowded with too small restrooms, but good food and beverages.
Great lounge, it was well worth the price. The entire staff were very hospitable. The food and drink options were reasonable.
Broken chairs, dirty bathroom, the massage chairs were out of service. Other than that amenities were good.
Took them 1+ hour to clear our plates. Subpar job cleaning up another patron’s crumb-y mess prior to our arrival. Bartenders & initial staff attentive. WiFi passes worked after 5+ login strips.
Great experience! Would definitely recommend! I was surprised to read negative staff reviews because I got served by an extremely pleasant guy named Vikas. Super cool and polite waiter!

The lounge is the Cadiz Tapas Bar. After you register at the Priority Pass desk, some drinks are free, and the buffet is free. You pay for anything else, just like a member of the public. Recommended.
Best thing was the customer service, very friendly and staff go out of their way to make you feel comfortable and warm.
Nice place to recharge our battery, food was nice.
It was really nice to charge my battery in this place. Staff was really nice and food was good. Definitely would come back:)
Nice, quiet lounge. Nice food. Good value.
This lounge was perfectly priced if done through LB app. Your getting more for your bang at this lounge versus Emirates. My party of 4 used it for 4hrs. We slept, drank and had breakfast.
Based on reviews I was sceptical to book here; however, I was warmly welcomed by my host Vikas whose hospitality is impeccable, he checked on me every few minutes and made sure everything was fine.
Fantastic lounge for those not in first or business class. Food is amazing and service is outstanding. I’ve been to a few lounges and this is by far the best. Quiet too. Electric massage chairs!

Great lounge with food and comfy seating, the only complaint is that people were sleeping on massaging chair for a long time and were not giving others a chance to relax. There should be a time limit.
There’s a lot of negative reviews. I was quite impressed. Fresh hot cooked Indian foods from Cadiz tapas bar. A vegetarian dish, veal, chicken, and lamb. Plus cheese, salads, breads, and deserts.
The food options were limited but good, the only negative point was that the rice was undercooked. The place was not crowded and had ample alcohol options.
Best lounge ever. They have blankets and large sofas to lay down and was very quiet. Food and service was great. This one will be hard to beat.
This lounge is very close to the Marhaba Lounge on concourse B, so forget about Marhaba and go straight to Cadiz Tapas Bar (the lounge is located inside). Marhaba is just a crowded waiting room.
An amazing lounge. Spacious, all the comfort needed, beautiful food including Tapas bar and wine plus cocktails etc. The staff could not have been more attentive. Quality!
We stayed here for 6 hours. The food was absolutely delicious and the service is professional. I recommend this lounge for anyone traveling via Dubai.
Very clean, comfortable and with good selection of food and drinks.
Nice clean place, very nice associates, LoungeBuddy is half the price of walk up price.
Perfect escape from the madden crowd below. Table service for coffee (just had my 2nd), drinks and pancakes! Hot buffet plus a great selection of pastries. Am about to hit the showers too.
The bad reviews concerning the service...;-(
Poor service and quality. Never going back again.

Basically the lounge is really nice except there are people who are lazy and don’t work at all. Owner wasting money on this. There was a guy called Vikas really busy making his own Chai, couldn’t take my order.
Very peaceful lounge. Great food, attentive staff, access to good showers and plenty of space to have a nap away from the noise of the departure gates. Massage chair is a bonus!
Comfy and quiet during my visit (6-9am). Buffet is nice and varied. Great service for Vikas that ensured I woke up on time for my next flight. Thanks!
Not a lounge but a restaurant. Hard to locate as there are no signs (take the elevator in the middle of Mc Donald’s to Cadiz Tapas Bar). Nicely decorated and being a floor high makes it more quiet.

Very average lounge. Seating OK. Low points: little choice in the way of food, only 3 types of sandwiches (egg, seafood and roast vegetable). Local hot food (spicy). Better choosing a more central lounge.
Shower for free (outside the lounge) and there are sofas and massage chairs, good food. Staff was very nice, especially the receptionist and Mr Castro.

Best lounge in DXB. Drinks & meals are all good. Staff esp Shakoor are all nice. With lounge chairs to take nap. Shower is 5min walk but all worth it because you can do shower in a very convenient way.
Food selection is extremely mediocre and limited. Drinks are also somewhat limited. It’s very annoying that walk in costs twice as much as buying an entrance 24 hours ahead through this site.
Though space is limited but food and selection of drinks are reasonable. Come early to avoid crowd.
Paid AED249 to find ALL soft seating in lounge being used as beds. This should NOT be allowed. I had to sit at a table in the dining area. NO power points-VERY POOR food selection. Waste of money!!!
Currently here. The noise is dreadful - no power points to charge up phones etc, no magazines or papers, no flight displays. Wish I’d gone elsewhere.
This one was a rip off and I want my money back. Food was limited. You could not even get a cooked breakfast. The lounge has barely any seating space and only one washroom. Stay away from this.
Worst lounge I have ever been to. The staff is extremely rude. Also, the food options are very limited. The quality of service is also mediocre. I would not recommend this lounge at all!
Quiet at 6am. Plenty of nooks and crannies. Noisy from airport. Buffet not ready at 6am still. Strong drinks selection included for Priority Pass. Service a bit slow, despite being quiet.
Arrived at the lounge to a huge line of people waiting to enter! Finally entered and CONSTRUCTION work on-going next door! No peace and quiet! Chairs well used! Food wasn't up to much! Drinks OK.
Clean toilets. Comfortable chairs. Good enough internet but not sufficient for Netflix to run smooth. Food selection is present but nothing special, a little bit underwhelming. Overall good option.
Outside in open area, not quiet. It's the Cadiz Tapas bar..shouldn't it have had some Spanish food instead of Indian. Showers moldy.. lost stars for not having the red wine listed & showers.
Fairly empty during my time, 6-8am. Drinks were great, the food and snacks hit the spot, and it was plenty quite away from the hustle and bustle downstairs. The price is just right, recommend.
Surprisingly good food, fresh bread and very good red wine. I visited around 2PM and was not crowded.
Free shower using Dubai Intercontinental Hotel facility.
Might as well sit in any restaurant. Food is awful, they probably serve better food at local hospitals. Waste of money.
This is not a first class lounge, but it's very pleasant and accommodating. The food is okay, not stellar. I was able to nap on a sofa, then take the hike to the showers. Superb value in my opinion.
Very understanding reception. Staff were great even though shower could be a hassle. Food might have missed a bit but content. Free bar and everything else. Great for the stopover!
Quiet and relaxing. Service very good.
The lounge was great, food was very filling, and there was a full bar for drinks. Service was great too. We stayed in an area with lounge chairs and it was a bit warm in that part of the lounge.

Food & liquor was great! I also used the showers and it was clean and nice to have a shave and shower before my 14 hour flight. There is buffet style food which was nice and filling with good variety.

I booked this lounge for 6 hours. Food was nice, I had dinner & breakfast here. Concierge were lovely. Showers are a walk away but was accompanied by a member of staff who showed me where to find them.
Cold food, very very few eating options with very limited non alcoholic drinks. Very disappointed for a lounge I paid $80 for 4 hours.
Great staff, modern, clean. Wifi doesn't work. If you need to connect to the Internet and get some work done, this place probably won't work. Didn't for me :(
Better than the Marhaba lounge I think. The Marhaba one was very crowded and the food was only okay. At this lounge less crowded and it's an actual restaurant so food was better.
This was a great lounge, fast internet, good food, friendly efficient service. Low lighting and quiet. I will definitely use this lounge again.
Everything was fantastic. The wifi is fast, the staff is super helpful, the showers are a bit of a walk, but worth it. Sushi bar and dessert bar were my favorites (after the free wine of course).
Excellent lounge - food was really great and service wonderful. Very quiet lounge with low lighting very calming.
We spent time in the lounge on a 5hr layover between Warsaw and Joburg. Great reception, friendly and happy staff. There was plenty of tasty and well presented food. Showers are in the Dubai Hotel.
Apple crumble was way too far gone but they were still in the food section. Salad veggies were long gone. Food was really terrible. And manager was very very irresponsible. Very very disappointed.
Great food selection and has shower facility. Great option for hot day in Dubai.
Nice lounge...shower is located far away in the hotel...nice selection of food...friendly staff.
While the food is good, this is like a hotel foyer that you pay to use. The food is nice, the staff are efficient & polite, & the wifi is good, but the seating is uncomfortable for more than 20 mins.
Very nice moment we spent 8 hours between 2 flights, very kind staff bringing some covers in order for us to rest...Food always reloaded, hot or cold, nice cheese, also sushi, well cool moment.
Excellent hidden away gem in Concourse B. Good food and very quiet in comparison to Marhaba or Emirates.
Love the food choices. Really good food. Pleasant ambience. Could improve the wine selection.
The wifi is a bit sketchy, but the lounge itself is beautiful and the staff is very attentive. Limited power outlets is a bummer but they are around if you search. Overall, a great getaway.
Very nice lounge. Much better than Marhaba. Food is excellent and in AM you can order eggs or waffles. Huge buffet. Worth discovering! The tapas bar is the lounge.
Spent 4 hours of an 8 hour layover here. The staff were friendly and the atmosphere very nice and quiet. More comfortable seats would have earned this a full five stars. Very nice food and drinks.
Very nice lounge with good food and service but showers are literally on the other side of the terminal (10 minute walk).
I was the only one there. The showers, though a little bit of a walk, were excellent!
Lounge is actually the Cadiz tapas bar - very confusing. Once there though, food was outstanding and lounge very quiet and relaxing. Service for drinks a bit slow, but staff good when asked.
Great lounge...Had to hunt for it though....But quiet and peaceful.
Take the elevator right next to the McDonalds by B26.
Great lounge with better food than Emirates. Very empty with speedy wifi. Worth the hunt to find it!
It's hard to find. Tried the free buffet and cafe latte. Both very good.
Went to the Marhaba at B first which is only 50 yards away. Hot, crowded, miserable front desk. I resolved to find this place. No signage. Take elevator marked Cadiz tapas bar. Empty and fantastic.
Shower, though free, is miles away. That lets this place down. Some furniture seems a bit dated. Overall quiet and relaxing place. It takes 25 minutes from here to A gates. Beware!
The lounge was a pleasant surprise. It can't be found without inquiring, but don't give up: its worth it. There's no signage and it can't be seen from walking in the area indicated. It's fantastic!

location.terminalDirections: Arrivals Area.

otherLounges.name: Their Patio by Plaza Premium Group

location.terminalDirections: Located in the arrivals area after exiting baggage claim.
Take the lift located next to the souvenir shop to Level 6. Located prior to Gates A1-A12.
After Security Checkpoint and Passport Control, take the elevators located between Gates A1 and A24 to the Hotel Reception on Level 6.
Level 4, between Gates A1 and A24.
Level 5, between Gates A2 and A3. Entrance is via dedicated elevator from the perfume area of the Duty Free Area.
Located in the West Wing of Concourse A, between Gates A2 and A3. Take the lift from the Duty Free Area to the entrance on Level 4.
Opposite Gate A1 in the Duty Free Area.
5th Floor, between Gates A1 and A24
After Security Checkpoint and Passport Control, take the elevators located near Gates B14 or B22 to the Hotel Reception.
4th Floor, between Gates B16 and B18, near the Information Desk.
Level 4, near Gate B21, entrance is right after XpresSpa.

otherLounges.name: Sleep n' Fly Sleep Lounge, Business Pods and Showers

location.terminalDirections: Located between Gates B14 and B18, close to the Emirates Connections Desk.
5th Floor, between Gates B16 and B18.
Located next to Gate C13.
After Security Checkpoint and Passport Control, take the escalators or elevators located between Gates C15 and C17 to the Hotel Reception.
East End of Concourse C, between Gates C21 and C23.

C-Gates, Central Lower Level Duty Free Area. Lounge check-in is via the separate main reception at departure gate level next to Gate C14. The sleep 'n fly lounge is located one level down in the Duty Free Area.
Near Gate C8.
Near Gate C28.
